vendor.description: The vendor for the VM, e.g. azure, amazon, etc.

format.description: The format of the VM's disk, such as vmdk, qcow2, and tier1.

version.description: The version of the VM definition.

description.description: A description of the VM that is typically set by the provider, but may also be edited.

location.description: The location of the VM, or its underlying storage.

config_xml.description: The VM or Template configuration in XML format. Deprecated.

autostart.description: Indicates whether or not the VM is set to autostart.

last_sync_on.description: Timestamp for last SmartState analysis synchronization.

created_on.description: The timestamp the VM was added to the app inventory.

updated_on.description: The last timestamp the VM was modified within the app.

guid.description: A value used to uniquely identify the VM internally.

last_scan_on.description: Timestamp for last SmartState analysis scan.

last_scan_attempt_on.description: Timestamp for last attempt to perform SmartState Analysis.

uid_ems.description: A globally unique reference for the VM across EMS.

retires_on.description: Timestamp the VM is to be retired.

retired.description: Indicates whether or not the VM is retired.

boot_time.description: The last time the VM was started.

standby_action.description: Action taken when VM is put into standby mode.

power_state.description: The current power state, typically 'on' or 'off'.

state_changed_on.description: The timestamp of the last power state change.

connection_state.description: Indicates the connection state of the VM, e.g. connected, disconnected, etc.

last_perf_capture_on.description: Timestamp for last performance metrics capture.

registered.description: Indicates whether the VM registered to a Provider. Deprecated.

busy.description: Indicates whether or not the VM is being scanned for SmartState analysis. Deprecated.

smart.description: Indicates whether or not smart proxy is enabled. Deprecated.

memory_reserve.description: Amount of memory that is guaranteed available for the VM.

memory_reserve_expand.description: Amount the memory can grow beyond its normal limits if there are unreserved resources available.

memory_limit.description: The absolute memory limit for the VM.

memory_shares.description: The number of memory shares allocated. Used to determine resource allocation in case of resource contention.

cpu_reserve.description: Amount of CPU that is guaranteed available for the VM.

cpu_reserve_expand.description: Amount the CPU can grow beyond its normal limits if there are unreserved resources available.

cpu_limit.description: The CPU utilization limit for the VM.

cpu_shares.description: The number of CPU shares allocated. Used to determine resource allocation in case of resource contention.

cpu_affinity.description: A comma separated list of host CPUs to schedule the VM on.

ems_created_on.description: The timestamp the VM or Templated was created on the EMS itself.

template.description: Indicates whether this is a VM or template.

linked_clone.description: Indicates whether the VM is a linked clone, i.e its disk is a referencing disk pointing to snapshot of another VM.

fault_tolerance.description: Indicates whether or not the VM is fault tolerant, i.e. if one host crashes it will immediately pick up on another host in the cluster.

type.description: An internal class name that includes the provider type.

ems_ref.description: A native unique reference for the VM within the EMS.

retirement_warn.description: Warning message when VM was put into retirement.

vnc_port.description: Port or port range used for VNC connections.

cloud.description: Indicates whether or not the VM/Template is cloud or infra.

raw_power_state.description: The power state refreshed from the EMS.

publicly_available.description: Indicates whether the VM is public or private.

retirement_requester.description: Userid of the user who requested retirement.

deprecated.description: Indicates whether or not a template is deprecated.

cpu_hot_add_enabled.description: Indicates if CPUs can be added to the VM while it is powered on.

cpu_hot_remove_enabled.description: Indicates if a CPU can be removed from a VM while powered on.

memory_hot_add_enabled.description: Indicates whether or not memory can be hot added to the running VM.

memory_hot_add_limit.description: The maximum amount of memory, in MB, that can be added to a running VM.

memory_hot_add_increment.description: Memory in MB that can be added to a running VM must be in increments of this value.

cpu_hot_remove_enabled.description: Indicates if a CPU can be removed from a VM while powered on.

name.description: The name of the task. Typically doubles as a description.

state.description: The current state of the task - Initialized, Queued, Active, Finished, etc.

status.description: The current status of the task - Ok, Warn, Error, Timeout, Expired, or Unknown.

message.description: Message associated with the task for logging or UI purposes.

userid.description: The userid that created the task, or 'system' if created by the appliance.

created_on.description: [builtin] The timestamp the record was created.

updated_on.description: [builtin] The timestamp the record was last updated.

pct_complete.description: The current completion percentage of the task.

context_data.description: Serialized metadata that may contain more detailed information about the task.

identifier.description: The resource this task is related to in 'class:id' format.

started_on.description: The timestamp the task was actually started.

zone.description: The zone in which the task should be executed, or any zone if null.
